statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: David Nichols scored 20 points and Devonte Campbell and Joe Cremo added double-doubles in points and rebounds and Albany (NY) dominated Maine from the start for a 74-56 on Sunday.
article.headline: Albany (NY) controls Maine behind Nichols in 74-56 win
article.linkText: Albany (NY) controls Maine behind Nichols in 74-56 win
article.story: ORONO, Maine -- David Nichols scored 20 points and Devonte Campbell and Joe Cremo added double-doubles in points and rebounds and Albany (NY) dominated Maine from the start for a 74-56 on Sunday. Campbell and Cremo each scored 10 points while Campbell grabbed 13 rebounds and Cremo 11. Albany (18-11, 9-5 America East) raced to a 19-2 lead and extended it to 26-6 -- on the strength of 12 points by Nichols -- with just under eight minutes to play before intermission. Maine (6-24, 2-13) didn't score until Austin Howard's jumper nearly six minutes into the game. The Black Bears were 3-for-19 shooting (16 percent) and 6 for 12 from the foul line, and the Great Danes built a 39-14 lead at the break. Nichols scored 16 first-half points on 7-for-12 shooting to outscore Maine. Maine scored 42 in the second half. Howard led the Black Bears with 12 points and Vincent Eze and Dennis Ashley each scored 10.
